description: Proposed extension of existing machinery store to enable machinery maintenance
decision_conditions: The development hereby permitted shall begin before the expiration of three years from the date of this permission.Reason: This is required by Section 91 of the Town and Country Planning Act 1990 (as amended).

The development to which this permission relates shall be carried out in accordance with the materials specified on the approved plans and on the submitted application form unless otherwise agreed in writing by the local planning authority.Reason: To ensure a satisfactory appearance on completion of the development, in accordance with Policy D3 of the London Plan 2021 and Policies CS8 and DM10 of the LDF Core Strategy 2012.

No development shall take place (including any works of demolition) until a Construction Environmental Management Plan (CEMP) has been submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority. The approved plan/statement shall be adhered to throughout the construction period. The statement shall provide for:o All contractors must be made aware of the presence of the designated site through a toolbox talk and its inclusion on all contractor drawings; o Any storage of machinery or equipment must be on the hardstanding within the greenkeeper's yard; o The working area must be marked out with temporary rope and post fencing or Netlon in advance of works to ensure there are no incidental impacts outside the working area; o Measures to ensure site runoff does not enter the adjacent habitat must be in place during construction;o Standard pollution prevention guidelines must be followed at all times; o All access routes must follow the existing hardstanding pathways and roads; o Any temporary construction lighting must follow the guidance provided below for minimising impacts on foraging and commuting bats; o Dust control measures must be in place when necessary during construction; o All other mitigation measures outlined within the approved Preliminary Ecological Appraisal dated December 2021 must be included within the  document.Reason: To safeguard the biodiversity and nature conservation value of the site, in accordance with policy G6 of the London Plan 2021 and policies CS3 and DM6 of the LDF Core Strategy 2012. This condition must be a pre-commencement condition in order to be effective.

The development shall be implemented and retained  in accordance with the mitigation recommendations set out within Section 5  of the  Preliminary Ecological Appraisal dated December 2021.Reason: To safeguard the biodiversity and nature conservation value of the site, in accordance with policy G6 of the London Plan 2021 and policies CS3 and DM6 of the LDF Core Strategy 2012.

Prior to beneficial use of the development to which this permission relates, the recommendations contained within  Section 6 of Preliminary Ecological Appraisal dated December 2021, shall be implemented in full and permanently retained thereafter. The measures to be included are:o The inclusion of bat boxes on the mature trees around the Site. o The inclusion of bird nest boxes on the existing buildings around the greenkeeper's yard.o the extent of lowland heath habitat should be extended and rhododendron should be removed and replaced with native trees and shrubs Reason: To safeguard the biodiversity and nature conservation value of the site, in accordance with policy G6 of the London Plan 2021 and policies CS3 and DM6 of the LDF Core Strategy 2012.
